document.docAuthor: Palacio, Edgard, Bordera, Santiago, Sääksjärvi, Ilari E. & Díaz, Francisco
document.docTitle: Clistopyga splendida Palacio & Bordera & Sääksjärvi & Díaz 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Clistopyga splendida
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other species of the
C. isayae
species group by the combination of the following characters: subalar prominence densely punctate, at least with 24 setiferous punctures ( Fig. 11A ); occipital carina present dorsally as a pair of mediodorsal wrinkles and ventrally as a short vestige ( Fig. 11D ); distance between hind ocelli 0.74–0.75 × maximum diameter of posterior ocellus; fore wing with vein 2 rs-m about 0.44–0.50 × as long as abscissa of M between 2 rs-m and 2 m-cu ( Fig. 7G ); hind wing with abscissa of Cu 1 between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a 1.75 × as long as Cu 1 b ( Fig. 7H ).
Description. Female: Body length 11.8–14.4 mm . Fore wing length 8.4–10.1 mm .

Mesosoma
(
Figs 7D, 7I
, 11A ). Pronotum shiny, mostly smooth, with fine and scattered setiferous punctures in upper posterior part. Mesoscutum entirely smooth and shiny, with fine and sparse setiferous punctures. Notauli deep, reaching about 0.42 of length of mesoscutum (
Fig. 7I
). Mesopleuron shiny, with moderately sparse setiferous punctures, except in posterior part under speculum. Subalar prominence densely punctate, with about 24–42 setiferous punctures ( Fig. 11A ). Epicnemial carina weak, its dorsal end straight, ending at level of centre of pronotum. Metapleuron shiny, glabrous, except for some sparse setiferous punctures at posterior end, 2.7–2.9 × as long as deep. Propodeum smooth and shiny, with sparse and fine setiferous punctures laterally; in dorsal view 1.2– 1.3 × as long as medially wide. Propodeal spiracle contiguous with groove separating propodeum and metapleuron, groove not interrupted by spiracle ( Fig. 7D ). Hind leg with femur 4.16–4.26 × as long as deep, 0.90–1.01 × as long as tibia.

Wings ( Figs 7G–H ). Fore wing with vein cu-a opposite Rs & M . Vein 2rs-m about 0.44–0.50 × as long as abscissa of M between 2rs-m and 2 m-cu . Abscissa of Cu 1 between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a 1.75 × as long as Cu 1 b ( Fig. 7G ). Hind wing with vein cu-a about 0.27 × as long as abscissa of Cu 1 between M and cu-a (7H). Vein cu-a reclivous, abscissa of Cu 1 vertical and slightly curved. Vein Cu 1 well pigmented.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
C.
splendida
Palacio
& Bordera
sp. nov.
, holotype, ♀. A. Head, lateral view. B. Head, frontal view. C. Head, dorsal view. D. Mesosoma , lateral view. E. Metasoma, lateral view. F. Ovipositor. G. Fore wing, upper and lower arrows indicates abscissa of Cu 1 (between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a ) and vein Cu 1 b , respectively. H. Hind wing, upper and lower arrows indicates abscissa of Cu 1 (between M and cu-a ) and vein cu-a , respectively. I. Mesosoma , dorsal view. J. Metasoma, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific name refers to the beautiful colour patterns of this species.
